questions.question: Which of the following is not a JavaScript data type?
questions.explanation: JavaScript does not have a Character data type. Characters in JavaScript are represented as single-character strings.

questions.question: What function would you use to print something to the console in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: console.log() is the function used to print or log messages to the console in JavaScript.

questions.question: What does the '===' operator do in JavaScript?

options.text: Assigns a value to a variable
Compares values and types for equality
Compares values for equality, not types

questions.explanation: The === operator (strict equality) compares both the values and the types for equality, returning true only if both match.

questions.question: Which method adds one or more elements to the end of an array in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The push() method adds one or more elements to the end of an array and returns the new length of the array.

questions.question: What keyword is used to define a function in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The 'function' keyword is used to define a function in JavaScript.

questions.question: Which image shows the correct way to structure an HTML document?
questions.explanation: The first image shows the correct HTML structure with proper nesting of DOCTYPE, html, head, and body elements.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
questions.explanation: The 'color' property is used to change the text color of an element in CSS.

questions.question: What HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The <a> (anchor) tag is used to create hyperlinks in HTML.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to add space between the border and content of an element?
questions.explanation: The 'padding' property adds space between the border and the content of an element in CSS.

questions.question: Which image represents a responsive design layout?
questions.explanation: The second image shows a responsive design layout that adapts to different screen sizes.
